                                String taskId,
                                String taskseriesId,
                                String listId)
                         throws ServerException,
                                RtmApiException,
                                IOException

tasksSetRecurrence

public List<Task> tasksSetRecurrence(String timeline,
                                     String taskId,
                                     String taskseriesId,
                                     String listId,
                                     String recurrence)
                              throws ServerException,
                                     RtmApiException,
                                     IOException
Sets a recurrence pattern for a task. Task properties behave a bit differently between tasks set to repeat 'Every...' and those set to repeat 'After...'. Tasks that repeat 'Every' create a task series: task properties and notes are common across all instances of the task. Tasks that repeat 'After' work a bit differently: these do not create a task series, but rather create a new, independent task each time a task is generated. Task properties are copied from the previous instance. Each 'after' task has its own properties and notes, and isn't tied to other tasks. Additionally, notes are not copied from previous instances.

Parameters:
timeline - the timeline string
taskId - the ID of the task to perform the action on
taskseriesId - the ID of the taskserie in which the specified task is contained
listId - the ID of the list in which the specified task is contained
recurrence - The recurrence pattern for a task (See repeat format)
Returns:
the list of Task (taskserie) of the changed task
Throws:
ServerException - if server answer with an error message
RtmApiException - API fatal error
IOException - if server is unreachable for many reasons

tasksSetRecurrence

public List<Task> tasksSetRecurrence(String timeline,
                                     Task task,
                                     String recurrence)
                              throws ServerException,
                                     RtmApiException,
                                     IOException
Sets a recurrence pattern for a task Task properties behave a bit differently between tasks set to repeat 'Every...' and those set to repeat 'After...'. Tasks that repeat 'Every' create a task series: task properties and notes are common across all instances of the task. Tasks that repeat 'After' work a bit differently: these do not create a task series, but rather create a new, independent task each time a task is generated. Task properties are copied from the previous instance. Each 'after' task has its own properties and notes, and isn't tied to other tasks. Additionally, notes are not copied from previous instances.

Parameters:
timeline - the timeline string
task - the task to perform the action on
recurrence - The recurrence pattern for a task (See repeat format)
Returns:
the list of Task (taskserie) of the changed task
Throws:
ServerException - if server answer with an error message
RtmApiException - API fatal error
IOException - if server is unreachable for many reasons
